hackathon-description-text: The CMU EdTech Club is sponsoring a small ideathon for the Spring of 2018! The prize for the best submission (as determined by the EdTech Board) will be a
hackathon-eligibility: You must be a Carnegie Mellon University student in order to participate in this Ideathon.
hackathon-requirements:
Your submission must include the following:
Of course, how you fulfill these requirements is up to your creative discretion.
hackathon-rules:
Your submission can be formatted however you choose, so long as it addresses the submission requirements. Bullet Points, Paragraph, Essay, Video, Drawing, Poem, and PowerPoint Presentation are some examples of ways you can format your submission.
Additionally, by submitting an entry to this Ideathon, you give the CMU EdTech Club permission to publically display/feature your submission on our website and/or social media if we choose to do so.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The EdTech Board will determine the Best Submission to be awarded the Google Home Mini based on creativity, effort, appeal, practicality, and uniqueness of the submission.

hackathon-description-header: What is an Innovative or Out of the Box way to use Technology to improve Education?
